messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
How far am I from the Golden Gate Bridge
Sure—what’s your current location? If you can share your latitude and longitude (or a specific address/place), I can calculate the distance to the Golden Gate Bridge for you.
I don't know my current location.

No problem— to compute the distance I need some idea of where you are right now. You can help by providing any of the following:

• Your current latitude and longitude (for example, from your phone’s map app)  
• A street address, city, or ZIP code  
• Even just the name of the neighborhood or landmark you’re near

Once you share your location, I’ll calculate how far you are from the Golden Gate Bridge.
I can check my location if you can guide me on how to do it.

Here are a few easy ways to find your current latitude/longitude (or address) depending on the device you’re using. Once you have that info, just share it and I’ll compute the distance to the Golden Gate Bridge.

1. On an iPhone (iOS Maps or Compass)  
   a. Open the built-in “Maps” app.  
   b. Tap the blue dot showing your location.  
   c. A panel will slide up displaying your coordinates (latitude & longitude).  
   d. You can also tap “Share” to copy them.  
   — Or—  
   a. Open the “Compass” app (preinstalled).  
   b. The coordinates appear at the top.

2. On an Android phone (Google Maps)  
   a. Launch Google Maps.  
   b. Tap the blue dot marking your position.  
   c. Your latitude/longitude will appear at the bottom in a small info card.  
   d. Tap the card to expand and copy those numbers.

3. On a Windows/Mac/Linux computer (Google Maps in a browser)  
   a. Go to https://www.google.com/maps  
   b. Click the “Locate” (target) icon to center the map on you (if you granted location permission).  
   c. Right-click your blue dot (or approximate location) and choose “What’s here?”  
   d. A box at the bottom will show the coordinates.

4. Via a quick web search  
   a. In your browser, type “what is my location” or “my latitude longitude.”  
   b. Google (or another search engine) will display your approximate coordinates immediately.

5. Find your address (if you prefer)  
   • Instead of coords, you can share a street address, city, or ZIP code.  
   • I can use that to estimate the distance too.

Once you’ve got either (a) latitude & longitude or (b) an address/ZIP code, just paste it here and I’ll run the distance calculation for you.
Let me check Google Maps. Give me a sec.
Sure—take your time. Just let me know your coordinates (latitude and longitude) or your address/ZIP code when you have them, and I’ll calculate the distance to the Golden Gate Bridge.
I checked, but I still can't find my location.

If you’re still unable to pull exact GPS coordinates, you have two easy fall-backs:

1. Give me any address, city, or ZIP code you know—even roughly—like “Downtown Chicago” or “90210,” and I’ll estimate the distance from there to the Golden Gate Bridge.  
2. Use a simple website that shows your lat/long without needing an app. For example:  
   • Go to https://www.latlong.net/convert-address-to-lat-long.html  
   • Click “Use My Location” (you may need to allow the browser to see your location)  
   • It will display your latitude and longitude—then just copy those here.

Let me know whichever works best for you (an approximate address or the coords), and I’ll calculate the distance right away.
I tried a few options but none are working.

No worries. If you can’t pull exact GPS coordinates, even a rough location—like the city, town, neighborhood or ZIP code you’re in—will let me estimate the distance. 

For example:  
• “I’m in Seattle, WA”  
• “Zip code 10001”  
• “I live in Brooklyn”  

Just let me know whatever you do know about where you are right now, and I’ll use that to calculate your distance from the Golden Gate Bridge.
